description: House-pop (sometimes also called "pop-house") is a crossover of [[house music|house]] and [[dance-pop]] music that emerged in early '90s. The genre was created to make house music more radio friendly. The characteristic of house-pop is similar to [[diva house]] music, like over-the-top vocal acrobatics, bubbly synth riffs, and four-on-the-floor rhythm. House-pop also has hip-hop influence.
